title: Pakistan’s missions abroad mark Eid Miladun Nabi (PBUH) with message of peace & harmony
content:
The embassies and high commissions of Pakistan across the world celebrated Eid Miladun Nabi (PBUH) with traditional zeal and fervour.
The activity at the missions exuded a religious and spiritual aura emphasizing the true teachings of Islam, particularly peace, harmony and brotherhood.
The envoys at the special events, organized to mark the auspicious occasion, highlighted various aspects of the life of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).
As part of celebrations of Eid Milad-un-Nabi (PBUH), the embassy of Pakistan in Turkey organized a Mehfil-e-Milad at Pakistan Embassy School Ankara on Tuesday evening.
Ambassador of Pakistan Muhammad Syrus Sajjad Qazi in his remarks said that the Holy Prophet (PBUH)’s entire life is an excellent model for all of us to emulate.
The Pakistan embassy in Azerbaijan organized Mehfil-e-Milad to celebrate the auspicious occasion of Eid Milad-un-Nabi. The Pakistani community including students attended the event.
Pakistan High Commission London celebrated Eid Milad-un-Nabi (SAW) with religious zeal. Led by Leena Salim Moazzam, the wife of the High Commissioner, the Mehfil-e-Milad-un-Nabi at the Chancery Hall of the Mission gathered a large number of women and children from the UK-based Pakistani community.
High Commissioner to Australia Zahid Hafeez Chaudhri attended the Seerat-un-Nabi (S.A.W) Peace Conference organised by Pehchan Media Network as a keynote speaker. In his remarks, the High Commissioner underscored that Islam is a religion of peace, justice, equality, compassion and moderation.
Consul General in Housten Abrar Hashmi attended the Seerat conference marking Eid Milad un Nabi at Ghous e Azam Mosque in Humble, Texas. The participants including famous Naat khawan Sabi Rehmani and others highlighted that life of Prophet (PBUH) is a model for humanity.
The Jashan-e-Eid Miladun Nabi event was held at the Consulate General of Pakistan in Los Angeles, where Consul General Abdul Jabbar Memon highlighted the life of the Prophet (PBUH) as a beacon of life.
Acting High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Tanvir A Bhatti attended the Eid Miladun Nabi celebrations at Sri Lanka’s Temple Trees – the official residence of the prime minister, at the invitation of Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa.
Ambassador to Sweden Zahoor Ahmad spoke about the need to follow the footprints of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) at an event marking the Eid Milad celebrations.
An event was held at Pakistan High Commission in Tanzania to commemorate the Eid Milad Un Nabi.
An event on “Naat” literature was hosted by the Consulate General of Pakistan, Toronto on the occasion of Eid Miladun Nabi. Consul General Abdul Hameed, Ambassador (retd) Karamat Ghori, Syed Sabih Rehmani, Dr Abdul Rehman Abd and Dr Taqi Abedi spoke on the occasion.
High Commissioner for Pakistan to Canada Khurram Rathore at an event to mark Eid Miladun Nabi said the biggest lesson in the life of the Holy Prophet (PBUH) is the purification of the self in body and soul. He said implementing the Prophet’s message in our lives is the only way to eternal salvation.
A virtual event was organized by the Embassy of Pakistan in Vietnam to commemorate the birth of the Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), which was attended by a large representative group of the community in Vietnam.
A Mehfil-e-Milad was held at the Pakistan Mission to the UN to celebrate the birth of the Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).The event was attended by the officers and staff of the Pakistan Mission. Recitation from the Holy Quran and Naats were offered to pay respect and tribute to the Holy Prophet (PBUH).
Pakistan’s Ambassador to the UN, Munir Akram, in a message to mark the occasion, said that Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was a man of virtue, a perfect model in all aspects of life, adding, “His noble example is a perpetual beacon which lights the way for all humanity.”
The Pakistan embassy in Denmark celebrated the occasion with religious zeal and fervor. The embassy building was illuminated and Ambassador Ahmed Farooq participated in an event organized by the Pakistani community.
To express love and respect for the Holy Prophet (Peace and blessings of Allah be upon Him), the last and final of all messengers of Allah, a ceremony was organised at the Consulate General House Hong Kong. The qualities of the Prophet PBUH were highlighted on the occasion.
The embassy of Pakistan, Tokyo organized a Mehfil-e-Milad to celebrate the birth of the Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).
On the auspicious occasion of 12th Rabi-ul-Awal, the embassy of Pakistan in Cairo, Egypt organized a Mehfil-e-Milad to celebrate the Eid Miladun Nabi at Chancery with religious zeal and fervor.
The building of the embassy of Pakistan in Kyrgyzstan was illuminated on the auspicious occasion of Eid Miladun Nabi.
High Commission of Pakistan in New Delhi, India celebrated Eid Milad-Un-Nabi (PBUH) at the High Commission’s premises. The building and the Chancery mosque were decorated and illuminated at night to mark the revered occasion. Talawat and Naat recitation competition was held. The Chargé d’Affaires distributed prizes among the children. Special prayers were offered for peace and prosperity of the country and the world.
A Mehfil-e-Milad was held at Pakistan Embassy in Paris, where community members including children recited the Naats. Charge d’Affaires Amjad Qazi and other speakers highlighted various aspects of the life of Holy Prophet (PBUH). Ambassador Qazi emphasized that by following Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)’s teachings in its true spirit, humanity can achieve salvation and overcome challenges that we face today.
Pakistan embassy in Niger marked the event of Eid Miladun Nabi with zeal and fervour.
The embassy in Vienna celebrated the Eid Miladun Nabi, where the local community gathered to mark the joyous occasion.
The embassy of Pakistan in Rome and the Consulate in Milan organized the ceremony on the birth anniversary of the Holy Prophet (PBUH).
In Switzerland, Ambassador Amir Shaukat will attend an event on Eid Miladun Nabi on October 23 in the city of Basil.
–Compiled for APP Digital by Shumaila Andleeb
